skill.name: incident-runbook-templates
skill.description: Create structured incident response runbooks with step-by-step procedures, escalation paths, and recovery actions. Use when building runbooks, responding to incidents, or establishing incident response procedures.
skill.summary: Create structured incident response runbooks with step-by-step procedures, escalation paths, and rec...

security_audit.summary: No malicious patterns detected in the templates. The content is static guidance with example commands and links. No data theft or execution mechanisms are present.

content.value_statement: You need clear incident response steps under pressure. This skill provides ready templates with triage, mitigation, and communication guidance.
actual_capabilities: Provide a structured runbook outline with required sections
Include severity level definitions and response time guidance
Offer a service outage runbook with triage and mitigation steps
Offer a database incident runbook with SQL checks and actions
Provide escalation matrix and communication templates
limitations: Does not execute commands or validate outcomes
Examples assume Kubernetes and PostgreSQL environments
Requires customization for your services and tools
Does not provide live monitoring or alerting

use_cases.title: Handle a live outage
use_cases.description: Use the outage template to triage, mitigate, and communicate during an incident.

use_cases.title: Standardize runbooks
use_cases.description: Roll out consistent runbook structure and severity levels across teams.

use_cases.title: Learn response flow
use_cases.description: Study the templates to understand incident stages and escalation paths.

prompt_templates.title: Basic runbook outline
prompt_templates.prompt: Create a concise incident runbook outline for a SaaS API service with detection, triage, mitigation, verification, and communication sections.

prompt_templates.title: Service outage runbook
prompt_templates.prompt: Draft a service outage runbook for a payments API. Include triage steps, rollback actions, and escalation contacts.

prompt_templates.title: Database incident runbook
prompt_templates.prompt: Create a database incident runbook for PostgreSQL with connection exhaustion, replication lag, and disk space issues.

prompt_templates.title: Advanced on call playbook
prompt_templates.prompt: Extend a runbook with specific alerts, dashboards, and verification metrics for a microservice on Kubernetes.

output_examples.input: Create a service outage runbook for our billing service
output: Overview and impact checklist for billing service
Triage steps with health checks and rollback options
Mitigation paths for downtime, latency, and partial failures
Escalation matrix and communication templates for updates

best_practices: Customize commands and contacts to match your environment
Keep runbooks short and ordered by urgency
Review and update templates after each incident
anti_patterns: Leaving placeholders without owners or contacts
Including steps that require tribal knowledge

faq.question: Is this compatible with Claude, Codex, and Claude Code?
faq.answer: Yes. The templates are plain text and work in Claude, Codex, and Claude Code.

faq.question: What are the limits of these templates?
faq.answer: They provide guidance only and do not execute commands or monitor systems.

faq.question: Can I integrate this with our incident tools?
faq.answer: Yes. Replace placeholders with your PagerDuty, Slack, and dashboard links.

faq.question: Does it access or store sensitive data?
faq.answer: No. It is static content and does not read files or send data.

faq.question: What if a step does not match our stack?
faq.answer: Edit the command blocks and sections to match your services and tooling.

faq.question: How does this compare to a full incident platform?
faq.answer: It provides templates only, while platforms add automation and live incident coordination.
